src:
Živi za Jasno in prekmurski pokalni finale v Prekmurju
Amadej Maroša na 16 tekmah že presegel število golov iz prejšnje sezone. Najboljši strelec Mure živi za nogomet 24 ur na dan.
07 Nov 2019, 08:23 by Gorazd Nejedly
LJUBLJANA – »Za nogomet živim 24 ur na dan,« je svoj strelski izbruh razkril prekmurski nogometni junak minulega konca tedna Amadej Maroša. Muro je postavil ob bok Olimpiji in Mariboru v boju za prvaka. Njegov gol z glavo za 1:0 v nedeljskem derbiju proti Olimpiji pred polnimi tribunami v Fazaneriji je zasukal dvoboj v soboško korist. Spadal je v kategorijo mojstrovin, kakršne se ne bi sramovali niti najslovitejši strelci.V manj kot letu je 25-letni napadalec iz naselja Melinci pri Beltincih, ki živi v Odrancih pri srčni izbranki Jasni, naredil preskok od hvaležnega domačega igralca do enega najboljših napadalcev v slovenski ligi. »Prelomni trenutek je bila pomlad. Začel sem dosegati tudi gole. V jesenskem delu razen v pokalnem tekmovanju ga nisem zabil, v drugem se mi je odprlo in dosegel sem vseh sedem ligaških golov,« je povedal Amadej, ki je že pri osmih golih in ga le še dva ločita od ponovitve lanskega dosežka Roka Sirka. V prejšnji sezoni prvi strelec Mure (15 golov) je poleti odšel na Poljsko in Maroši predal strelsko štafetno paličico.»Zelo dobro sva sodelovala. V postavitvi 4-4-2 sva bila oba napadalca, v 4-2-3-1 je bil on prvi napadalec. Tudi v tej sezoni uporabljamo obe, pri prvi sem za udarnim napadalcem, pri drugi sem osrednji mož. Ampak pomembneje je bilo, da sem tudi takrat, ko nisem zabijal, dajal vse od sebe in igral. Vedel sem, da bom za trud slej ko prej nagrajen z goli,« je tudi strokovno pojasnil svojo vlogo na igrišču otrok Mure, ki ni čez noč postal odličen strelec. Kljub nižji rasti (177 cm) je odličen v skoku in igri z glavo, zdaj ko povrhu še zabija gole, je vreden zlata. Ampak tudi v mlajših kategorijah je bil vselej najboljši strelec. Toda šele Murina preobrazba v moštvo in klub visoke profesionalne ravni sta Amadeja spremenila iz amaterja v profesionalca.V obdobju Murinega mrka je bil napadalec s št. 17 tri leta član Beltincev, k črno-belim se je vrnil v tretji ligi in takrat je opustil delo na družinski kmetiji. Maroševi so sicer veliki pridelovalci ekološke hrane.Pri trenerju Anteju Šimundži je Amadej postal domala nenadomestljiv igralec. Zaradi svojega moštvenega pristopa, s katerim se res razdaja, ter marljivosti in vztrajnosti je izjemno priljubljen med navijači v celotnem Prekmurju. Amadej in drugi domači fantje so simbol zdajšnje Mure, ki pod Šimundževo taktirko napreduje s hitrostjo sprinterjev. Še v prejšnji sezoni so bili Sobočani novinci v 1. SNL, v tej so kandidati za dvojno krono.»Trener je predvsem realist. Vcepil nam je svojo miselnost, ki ni sanjaška, marveč seže le do naslednje tekme. Ta je vedno najpomembnejša, zato še ne razmišljamo o lovorikah. Daleč smo še, a je res, da dlje ko bomo v vrhu, bliže bomo morebitnemu podvigu. Ampak osnovni cilj je za zdaj uvrstitev v Evropo,« je poudaril Maroša in razkril veliko tekmovalno željo. »Pika na i bi bil pokalni finale Mure in Nafte v Prekmurju.«
text:
He lives for the Clear and Prekmurje Cup Finals in Prekmurje
Amadej Marosa already exceeded the number of goals from last season in 16 games. Mura's top scorer lives on football 24/7.
07 Nov 2019, 08:23 by Gorazd Nejedly
LJUBLJANA - "I live 24 hours a day for football," Amadej Maroš, a Prekmurje football hero, revealed his shooting eruption. He set Muro side by side with Olympia and Maribor in the fight for the champion. His goal 1-0 in Sunday's derby against Olympia in front of the full stands in Fazaneria turned the match into Saturday's favor. He was in the category of masterpieces that even the most famous shooters would not be ashamed of. In less than a year, the 25-year-old striker from Melinci near Beltinci, who lives in Odranci at Jasna's heartworm, made the leap from a grateful home player to one of the best strikers in Slovenian League. “The turning point was spring. I also started to get naked. In the autumn, except in the cup competition, I did not score it, in the second one it opened and I scored all seven league goals, "said Amadej, who is already eight goals away, and only two of them separate him from the repeat of last year's Rock Sirk. Last season, Mura's first goal scorer (15 goals) went to Poland in the summer and handed the shooting stick to Marosi. "We worked very well together. In the 4-4-2 lineup we were both strikers, in 4-2-3-1 he was the first striker. We use both this season as well, with the first one behind the striker, the second being the middle man. But more importantly, even when I wasn't entertaining, I did my best and played. I knew I would be rewarded with naked goals sooner or later, ”he also explained his role on the Mura children's playground, which did not become a great shooter overnight. Despite its lower height (177 cm), it is excellent in jumping and head-banging, and is now worth the gold when it hits the top. But even in the younger categories, he was always the top scorer. But it was only Mura's transformation into a team and high professional club that turned Amadeus from an amateur to a professional. 17 A three-year member of the Beltins, he returned to the Black and Whites in the third league and at that time he quit working on the family farm. The Maros are otherwise large producers of organic food. Under coach Ante Šimundža, Amadej became an almost irreplaceable player. Due to his team-going approach, his diligence and perseverance, he is extremely popular with fans throughout Prekmurje. Amadeus and the other home boys are the symbol of the current Mura, which is advancing at sprinters' speed under Šimundž's tactics. Last season there were Scoops newcomers to the 1st SNL, in this they are candidates for the double crown. ”The coach is above all a realist. He instilled in us his dream-like mentality, which only reaches the next game. This one is always the most important, so we are not thinking about laurels yet. We are far, but it is true that the longer we are at the top, the closer we will be to a possible endeavor. But the main goal for now is to be in Europe, "said Maroš, revealing a strong competitive desire. "The dot on i would be the Mura and Oil Cup final in Prekmurje."
